entry.et: Middle English wilde, from Old English; akin to Old High German wildi wild, Welsh gwyllt

def.dt: :living in a state of nature and not ordinarily tame or domesticated wild ducks
:growing or produced without human aid or care wild honey
:related to or resembling a corresponding cultivated or domesticated organism
:of or relating to wild organisms the wild state
:not inhabited or cultivated wild land
:not amenable to human habitation or cultivation
:desolate
:not subject to restraint or regulation :uncontrolled
:unruly
:emotionally overcome wild with grief
:passionately eager or enthusiastic was wild to own a toy train J. C. Furnas
:marked by turbulent agitation :stormy a wild night
:going beyond normal or conventional bounds :fantastic wild ideas
:sensational
:indicative of strong passion, desire, or emotion a wild gleam of delight in his eyes Irish Digest
:uncivilized barbaric
:characteristic of, appropriate to, or expressive of wilderness, wildlife, or a simple or uncivilized society
:deviating from the intended or expected course wild spelling C. W. Cunnington the throw was wild
:tending to throw inaccurately a wild pitcher
:having no basis in known or surmised fact a wild guess
:able to represent any card designated by the holder
:a sparsely inhabited or uncultivated region or tract :wilderness
:a wild, free, or natural state or existence
:in a wild manner: as
:without regulation or control plants that grow wild
:off an intended or expected course
:a perennial aromatic North American monarda (Monarda fistulosa) having a terminal cluster of pink or purple flowers
:an Old World wild hog (Sus scrofa) from which most domestic swine have been derived

entry.et: wild card, playing card with arbitrarily determined value

def.dt: :an unknown or unpredictable factor
:one picked to fill a leftover playoff or tournament berth after regularly qualifying competitors have all been determined
:a symbol (as ? or *) used in a keyword database search to represent the presence of zero, one, or more than one unspecified characters
:queen anne's lace
:tape grass
:any of various undomesticated canids (as an African wild dog or a dingo) that resemble the domestic dog
:having a wild expression in the eyes
:consisting of or favoring extreme or visionary ideas
